p: The scavenging capacity of samples against DPPH radical [ 24] was assessed according to the method of Blois [ 25], with some modifications. An aliquot (2.5 mL) of the diluted sample (1:10 in methanol) was mixed with 0.5 mL of DPPH• solution (1 mM prepared in methanol). The reaction mixture was vortexed thoroughly and left in the dark at room temperature (25 ± 1 °C) for 30 min. The decrease in the absorbance (due to the electron/proton donating activity) was measured at 517 nm using the UV–VIS spectrophotometer. The results are expressed as the concentration (g/100 mL) of essential oils or SNE, which reduces the concentration of radicals (IC 50) by 50%.
